website_summaries.verdict: A good basic propane smoker that allows you to smoke your meat with less hassle.
pros: Water/wood tray has its own door
Easy instructions make it easy to use
Compact design doesn't take up a lot of room on your deck or patio
cons: The assembly of this smoker takes a long time and may need some tweaks

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I read horror stories about being damaged in shipping and the thermometer on the do it being way off. This could not be farther from the truth! The package had 2 puncture/dents but the smoker was packed so well there was no damage! It was very easy to assemble the directions were great! Very strong/sturdy construction! I have already used it twice , only had it a few days, and everything was great. Just received my digital remote thermometer for the meat and the smoker and the thermometer on the door is right on! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Kohlegk

customer_reviews.title: Under powered, bad unit.
customer_reviews.text: Thought the name spoke for itself, but this is a poorly constructed smoker. It’s totally under powered (btu’s) and in order to keep an optimum smoke temp of anything over 225, you need to crank it on high and it blows through propane. The water pan is terribly small. It’s flimsy and is only about a half inch. The smoke bowl is tiny and can only be used with a small amount of wood, so changing the bowl to keep a good smoke happens often. This same bowl doubles as a water pan and if there’s water in the pan the wood won’t smoke. Just a waste of my money. I should of paid more for a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy W. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived damaged. The door was bent and would not create correct seal. Attempted to use and could not achieve an internal temperature above 190. Cheaply made imo as well. Most screws stripped when assembling even though I used a screwdriver and not a drill. Stay in your lane, Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Not As Pictured and Defective Welds on Shelves
customer_reviews.text: The door hinges are different from the pictures on Amazon. I see a gap between the door and the opening of the smoker where smoke will escape Also, the welds on 2 of the stainless steel shelves are defective. The rods are not attached to the frame of the shelves. Not very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fixable Flaws
customer_reviews.text: This is a good smoker to begin with, it needs quite a few adjustments. First of all, the water/wood chip pan is extremely restrictive, so very little heat from the flame could go thru. To solve this problem, I used the water pan on the bottom grilling shelf, and drilled a bunch of holes on the very bottom pan. This method allows for the wood smoking bowl to still be used, but SO MUCH better temperature control!!! My next modification project is to cut out sheet metal “skirts” and pop rivet them in between the legs to act as wind barriers. The flame kept blowing out in breezy environments, otherwise I would give this smoker a full 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Adair

customer_reviews.title: Nice Birthday present
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled mine and ran it through the first cycle to burn off odors and such. Good quality build. Assembly was not bad. I did notice while running it for the first time that temperature on front thermometer read 280 deg F, while a good quality digital thermometer read about 20 degrees higher for internal smoker temperature. Will have to use digital thermometer in meat to get accurate temp. Only gave it four stars to start out with. After I smoke some food, will re-evaluate and rate based upon that experience.
customer_reviews.author: txm0523

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price. I read all the reviews and question/answer sessions at Amazon before buying this unit. If you pay attention to all the good advice, you will have good-fun experiences with this smoker. So much better than spending time with charcoal. I used the wood/water tray totally for wood with a combination of chips and chunks. Lasted 11/2 hours before refill was needed. I put a large-deep water tray on the first level rack. My first use this week was in 40 degree weather with great results.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a year, issues now with the fire staying ON!
customer_reviews.text: It makes great brisket. As long as the outdoor weather isn't to cold. I had an issue that fire kept going out. The water plant is to small. Over all besides for the issue with the fire going out I would recommend this smoker. I've probably make 10 10+ pound briskets on this and everyone LOVED them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy ... ended up repurposing as a cold smoker.
customer_reviews.text: Awful smoker ... unable to maintain heat levels. I ended up putting a seal on the door to help maintain smoke levels in the unit an repurposing the thing as a cold smoker and used a smoking tube (LIZZQ brand) w/pellets. The thing is useless!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Smoke heaven
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for the first time. Got real aggressive and smoked a pork butt, 2 racks of ribs and 20 chicken thighs. I need to experiment with the smoke and you have to check the water tray about every 20 to 30 min. but the flavor and juicyness of the meat was great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Could not get to 200 degrees
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd propane smoker, and I think it's my last. On 60-70 degree spring days, with the burner at full power, the internal temperature could not get past 175 degrees. This Cuisinart seemed to have a larger burner than my old Smokey Hollow unit, but it's also got a bigger capacity and the burner simply isn't large enough to generate enough heat to get to - and stay at -- 250 degrees while having an uncooked 10 lbs Boston Butt in it. I saw some of the reviews say they had similar problems ... I've come to the conclusion that propane smokers just don't get hot enough ... none of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: I've had great success with smokers in the past, but this one is a complete joke and I expected with a name like Cuisinart that this would be a quality product. I was beyond wrong! Horrible design that works very poorly. The smoker struggles to reach temp even with the gas at full blast, which causes the water to boil off very quickly. The food had literally zero smoke flavor. I can't return and replace this project with another brand fast enough. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Really well made, easy to assemble but difficult to maintain a constant temperature
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made smoker. The grates are super heavy duty compared to another brand I own, it was easy to assemble too. You can just see the quality in every part of the unit. The downsides are the built in thermometer is a little off compared to the digital unit I use. My biggest issue so far is that it requires constant attention during the smoking process to keep the temperature the same. If I were to do this over I would look for a smoker that has a thermostat to regulate the temperature/flame.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Product will not reach cooking temperature above200.
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this product but am extremely disappointed as it will not reach smoking temperature above 200 degrees. Followed the manual troubleshooting tip for this issue and it still is not heating up to a higher temperature. I can hear the burner air pressure and it inconsistent. Switched out propane tanks and this still did not help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expected greater quality
customer_reviews.text: At half the price. Not bad. But this isn’t the best quality for the premium price. I struggle to see what sets this smoker apart from a Model half the price. As I built it, I was not impressed with the quality of Materials or how the fitment was. This will last about 2-3 years. I’d say not much more. For the price point, I would expect far better quality.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Krumenacker

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you only use it in perfect, 60 degree + weather, with zero wind, no water in the tray and very little wood. Oh, also works great as long as you only use or try to cook on one tray. Try cooking multiple things at once, good luck. Wont ever get your smoker past 200 degrees. Absolute garbage. Better off spending extra to get a real smoker. No some garbage knocking like this p.o.s.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Exposed flame, frustrating...
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Easy assembly. Used it once. I had to keep adding moisture to my water pan and chips because it kept evaporating the water burned my wood chips. Also the exposed flame kept blowing out with a slight breeze. I finally gave up trying to create a wind block and finished my meat in the oven. Luckily I work in a steel fabrication shop and made side walls for around the legs. Have yet to try them out.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaLoverStayOUT

customer_reviews.title: Interior paint cooks into food
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrifying experience, smokers interior paint cooked into 3 racks of ribs I was smoking also customer service is avoiding both my emails and phone calls
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker, price, delivery and ease of use!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this smoker!! Well constructed, especially at that price point, easy to use and took about 10 minutes to set-up. The simplicity of design makes it very straightforward to use and I find that I have been using a great deal fewer chips in this smoker than last one. Does not "over smoke" and the temp is easily controlled with the dial and ensuring water is in the pan.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Missing a hinge pin, seems OK.  time will tell!
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled this past weekend. I have not yet cooked anything on it. One hinge was missing the cotter pin that holds it together, so I rigged one up with a machine screw. I did a test burn with nothing in it. Outside temp was about 65 degrees. After 25 minutes of being on high on a new propane tank, I could not get it hotter than 250. Maybe I needed longer, but it was starting to rain. I should be using it later this week for Memorial Day. I will try to update after that and compare to my old Masterbuilt Electric that finally died last month.
customer_reviews.author: Skape

customer_reviews.title: Hard to maintain heat.
customer_reviews.text: It’s very hard to maintain heat with this thing. As soon as the bottom tray goes in, the temp drops dramatically and it’s near impossible to get it back up.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bunschoten

customer_reviews.title: Well built but not really a smoker, to hot.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nicely built unit good quality. However the burner is a bit to large for use as a smoker when temps are above freezing. You have to keep the door open slightly or throttle down the propane at the bottle or you will cook rather than smoke whatever you are doing. Sure you can add water to the tray but the goal of smoking is to remove moisture. I ended up drilling holes with a hole saw around the top and am getting much better results.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Temp will not exceed 200 and thermometer installed incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed is the thermometer being installed with the reading upside down. Due to the design, the thermometer can only be installed the way it came properly so poor job on the quality inspection prior to the product leaving the factory. Second, the smoker will not exceed 200 degrees with the wood chip and water tray installed. The tray limits the heat into the food chamber but if it is removed you are able to get the temp that you desire. That defeats the purpose of having the smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell J

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: Smoker will NOT generate smoke... AT ALL It does make some nice charcoal eventually but the wood chip box does not get hot enough. I have tried everything I can think of and I have been using vertical smokers like this for 4+ years. DO NOT PURCHASE. I wish I could give 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Smoker
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for smoking multiple items. Heavy duty water and wood tray. Separate stainless drip tray which is very handy. Constructed well. Not much at clean up a couple of grills and the drip tray. Really convenient using propane. Don't have to reload with charcoal or wood just fill the water and wood tray a couple of times. Only thing negative is I wish the burner was bigger to generate more heat. Unit doesn't get much past 200 degrees and that's with an outside temp of +50 degrees. Usually smoke with the damper vent almost closed to retain as much heat as possible. Not expensive to get into smoking foods.
customer_reviews.author: Southerner

customer_reviews.title: 2 Smoker, 0 worked! Won't allow return
customer_reviews.text: First smoker had a defect. Door wouldn't close. Had to take the WHOLE thing apart, box it up and return it. Got the next one, won't heat up to even 200° to work. Called Cuisinart, they allegedly sent a part that was never received. Tried to return through Amazon but the return window expired while waiting for the part. Called Amazon to rectify, stayed on hold while they called Cuisinart for an hour before getting disconnected with no return phone call. Later get an email from Amazon saying call Cuisinart, good luck! Now I have an almost $300 giant door stop that smokes nothing and was a waste of a birthday gift and 3 months of my life....
customer_reviews.author: Ebonni

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: After the first few uses, never gets hotter than 220-225 degrees as measured with an internal ambient thermometer. Tried new/full propane tanks, turned to high, even put a wind shield around it. Same thing. Can't finish a big pork shoulder in a reasonable time with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: AvgJoeGuy

customer_reviews.title: For it to stay on !
customer_reviews.text: The smoker does not stay on, the flame keeps going out & no wind !
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Mshar

customer_reviews.title: Also the meat even after 6-8 hours doesn't come out "falling apart" so much as solid like a thanksgiving lump of pork or beef
customer_reviews.text: After three attempts, it really only "smokes" with the first round of wood chips, after that, not so much. They keep burning up every 45 minutes or so, but never really smoke. Also the meat even after 6-8 hours doesn't come out "falling apart" so much as solid like a thanksgiving lump of pork or beef. Yes I also keep adding beer/water to it with new chips every 45 minutes and keep the temp around 230 but nope after that first round it's mainly just heat/humidity not smoke. The meat is meh. Suggestions? I wouldn't have bought it if I knew it was like this.
customer_reviews.author: E. Preston

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker, easy to use. It has been used very frequently since I purchase it, never had any issues or problems. I would recommend this smoker to anyone. Temperature is easy to control and maintain. My only dislike is that the bottom rack really needs to hold the extra water pan. The main pan at the bottom holds both chips and water, but not enough water to make it worth the hassle. I always use just the extra pan on the lowest rack for water.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.text: The burner is not functional at the High setting, very sensitive and constantly goes out during use or with a light breeze. Water pan is too small, constantly have to refill. Cannot smoke large pieces of meat or whole rack without cutting them up to fit on the small racks. Very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad welds on cooking rack
customer_reviews.text: Two of the cooking racks had bad welds. Could not get through to customer service, left message and thus far have not received a call back.
customer_reviews.author: Hoffma

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The only reason i have it 4 stars is the vent. I see lost bolts in my future because if you tighten them as soon as you move it they are loose again! I thing being cuisinart itd have a better design for that. Moving parts and screws just dont mix! Other than that its great! Ribs turned out super yummy!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy G

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised that it was delivered before promise date, however it arrived damaged. We had to use pliers on the corner piece in order to attach the legs properly. Pictures attached of damage. Product as advertised. Tried it out once already and it seemed to work as expected. Will definitely be using again soon.
customer_reviews.author: TeamMom22

customer_reviews.title: The burner keeps going out
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to see this as a deal.of the day! I used it twice and I have to sit right by it now to restart it every so often. Like 10- 20 min. I'm pretty annoyed.. I think it's the regulator, actually. But I don't want to return it, pay shipping... I just want a new regulator if that's the problem. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Lara Miller

customer_reviews.title: Smokey the 🐻
customer_reviews.text: First time using a smoker everything seems good can't compare to any other since have never owned one. Door latch became loose wasn't sure how tight to make the handles. Material seems pretty stable and durable. Should use a different method for temperature instead of the thermometer on the front is not accurate so far. Can't think of anything else but has made some good food for me so far for an inexperienced smoker following online recipes.
customer_reviews.author: LULU

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker, easy to put together, husband loves!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect smoker, we love it and use it all the time. Not too big or too small. Have made wings, pork butt, etc and will get a lot more use out of it! Husband in his glory!! Was not difficult to put together and shipping was perfect. Great product and would order again!
customer_reviews.author: Lori & Bill

customer_reviews.title: Love it but could use a little design changes. Great otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker, it's our first one but it's great. I feel the legs are not super durable so wouldn't move it around to much. Design could use some work I feel. The water pan is almost needed to keep dripping's from meat from hitting and stops the "smoking" of the wood. That's the only reason I gave it a 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Fay

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after looking at several other models. So far it has been good. Doing some tweaking to get it just right. Came packed well. Had spare water tray. Bought a adjustable needle valve for more precise adjustments. Learning little each time. But food so far has been really good.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Merica

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome smoker. My husband really wanted to get one but I did not want to spend a fortune. This one is absolutely perfect! It holds its heat well. We have gotten nothing but a great smoke each use. I saw some negative reviews about the wood chip and water tray. If you pour the water slow it won’t spill over. I have zero complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Henning

customer_reviews.title: Look at other options
customer_reviews.text: It was awful, I returned it after the the pilot flame went out and the whole thing filled up with propane and ruined all the food
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: No problems to speak of other than the lack of instructions for smoking. Put together was easy. Love all the moisture you get. Larger smoke chips do not work well. Use the finer type. Wheels would be a nice addition. Kind of heavy if you move it when you use it like I do. All together it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Annas thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Smokin' Hot!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has NEVER been MORE pleased than he was when he got his smoker!! He has used it voraciously since he received it!!!!! It is a WONDERFUL PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: ThePrincess

customer_reviews.title: Arrived horribly damaged :(
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this sat for several weeks before we opened it because we were away, so we missed the return period. Opened it up to find the entire bottom completely crushed, making it unusable because there would be no way to install the legs and the heating element under the box. Since we couldn't return it, we took our chances and went at it with a sledge hammer. It's very wobbly and looks like hell, but we got it to work. Made bacon successfully! If it wasn't damaged, I'd probably give it 4-5 stars. Moral of the story and lesson learned: inspect your packages as soon as they arrive!
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe W Myers

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: First one came damaged. Amazon took care of (i did have to re box and drop off damaged unit at UPS) problem and got me a new one shipped out with no problems. happy with the product but the water pan is to small. it came with an extra pan (to ketch drippings i think) i use this a water pan and put on bottom shelve.
customer_reviews.author: jim jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Great choice.Don't forget to use the extra water pan.
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker, almost air tight.the best smoker I have ever used.lots of room, easy to use,easy to set up. Also it is powder coated, very strong compared to most smokers. Not cheap steel at all. It is a dream to run, maintains the temp very well.the only drawback to this model is not enough water held around chips.easy fix, they send you a extra pan to hold extra water. I would buy this smoker again, definetly. .
customer_reviews.author: dock_man4

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is my first smoker so I don't have much basis for comparison but it's been really easy to use and produced some great results. Well-built and even held heat while smoking in 40F degree temps (with a piece of plywood leaned against it to keep the wind off the burner)
customer_reviews.author: J A

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: True about the pan being shallow; I overcame it by just using the big pan for water on the bottom shelf and using the combo pan for the wood chips. Also, you can get wood chunks instead of chips and they burn longer. Use them together so the chips start the chunks. The attached thermometer is junk, get a digital ambient one.
customer_reviews.author: ASelvey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. Just right and you don’t have to mess with charcoal and watch it all the time to Kasparov the proper temperature. It makes the best ribs. We use wood chips and it really does the job. We said good by to the Weber upright charcoal one.
customer_reviews.author: George L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: get to know it
customer_reviews.text: this is a great smoker and really turns out the tasty food. my friend liked it so much that he his going to purchase one. read all you can about smoking food before you get it and you can start making great tasting items as soon as you receive it
customer_reviews.author: marine 1

customer_reviews.title: Terrible temperature control
customer_reviews.text: This thing refuses to hold a temperature, if there is even a slight breeze forget getting a temp that you need to cook at. It’s also terrible at producing enough heat to get any wood to smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Krzys

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love this smoker it is very well constructed for the price, ver sturdy, and material look they are going to last for ever. The only complaint is that the wood chips place is too small, you have to recharge it every hour, instead of that, I'm using the entire tray for wood and I'm adding another tray for water in one of the smoker shelves. Temperature does not go higher than 300 f but this is a smoker, you shouldn't go higher than this. I`m going to try it with 2 Boston Butts and a few ribs to see how it get it done.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfo Gomez Perez

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Just opened and product is damaged. We couldn’t tell from the package. Now we don’t have a box to ship it back because we had to cut the box up to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, nice first smoker.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first smoker and I’m really enjoying it. On a hot day I can get the temp up to 300, but I keep it at 250. Not sure how it will do on a cold day. I like the separate door for accessing the tray for wood chips and adding water. I have to check water levels about every 30 minutes. Each smoking session I go through about 1/4-1/3 tank of propane.
customer_reviews.author: lfod

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed Beware of this POS
customer_reviews.text: Does not get above 200 degrees. Flame constantly goes out. Upon relighting gas had built up inside and exploded burning my arm and beard. Very dangerous piece of junk. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Smoker for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent smoker for the price! It was easy to assemble with and adjustable wrench, standard screwdriver and phillips screwdriver. It does an excellent job smoking a variety of meats. I have done ribs, a beef roast, and large salmon filet so far. I did have to cut the rack of ribs in half in order for them to fit on the rack but otherwise no complaints. The walls are a bit a thin but there is little to no smoke leakage, all and all an excellent smoker for $126.
customer_reviews.author: The Baltimore Brom

customer_reviews.title: It will do.
customer_reviews.text: Can be summarized in "no pride in quality". Great construction, sturdy metal, comes together easily. Looks like crap because it was thrown together scratching the surfaces, over tightening screws, flimsy packaging. Edit: The gas valve locks up when the unit gets hot. You can only set the valve on the cold unit, need to turn off by shutting off the gas supply and let it cool to change.
customer_reviews.author: Mu

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly-Tasty Food
customer_reviews.text: My hubby just used it yesterday, Father's Day. He had to do some experimenting and we hade ribs and chicken quarters that came out very tasty. The only thing is that we wish we could find a cookbook that is for a propane smoker. So far we have only found ones for the electric smokers.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper in TX

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had other smokers and I've been very happy with them. The Cuisinart smoker is a very good product I am so satisfied. I've already used my new Cuisinart smoker and it works great ! assembly was as usual nothing special there. I did my gas leak test and used it the same day. I would recommend the Cuisinart smoker to anyone who loves to use a propane smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Darrontls

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: Work really well just a little disappointed because ever 15 min have to fill the water but what I did was put a tin pan in the grill part and fill it with water the best thing I did but other wise great
customer_reviews.author: roxanne gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed In The Appearance
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t used the smoker yet... praying it works well and to our expectations. Not at all happy with the appearance of this Christmas present for my husband. There’s a small dent on the top and quite a large gap on the top right side, where the door meets the top of the smoker. I’m hoping the functionality isn’t compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Went together fairly easy, does take more than 20 minutes with hand ...
customer_reviews.text: Went together fairly easy, does take more than 20 minutes with hand tools. Good solid build, some minor smoke leakage around the door seal, but can live with that. The one major issue is the combination wood chip and water plate; does not work. They do give you another seperate water drip pan, strongly suggest you use that and just put wood chips in the lower plate. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Easy smoking!
customer_reviews.text: I like this smoker. I like to smoke at temperatures between 200 and 225. This smoker will do this all day. Lots of room and easy to use. I would rate it 5 stars if the water pan were a separate unit with a separate tray holder. But there are disposable aluminum pans out there that will slide underneath the bottom rack and serve as a separate water pan.
customer_reviews.author: Michele B.

customer_reviews.title: Great gas smoker for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and build. Lowest gas setting delivered internal temps between 230-250F. I seasoned it today and it worked flawlessly. Looking forward to smoking a pork butt.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Hanna

customer_reviews.title: High quality item! Produces great food!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my dad for Father’s Day and he absolutely loves it!! He was like a kid in a candy store when he got it, and everything that he’s made has been delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with smoker
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with smoker. Works well. Temp gauge is inaccurate. But I bought a digital thermometer. No dents only minor scratches here and there. I use it all the time. Smoked salmon, chicken, baked beans, burgers, tofu, feta cheese. Everything comes out awesome.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I like the solid construction and simple instructions. The size is why it gets 3 stars. I had a 30in smoker same design. My 30in had more room for meat and more shelves. The water basin had it's own shelf bracket and the wood box I had was large and made of cast iron. What I got was a cute little tray maybe for a cat dish or something. not wood chips for sure. I reconstructed this box with parts from my old smoker to accommodate my wood box and water basin. Still lost valuable space for smoking. It works okay now.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Simon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have used our smoker 4 or 5 times since we bought it and we LOVE it! The food has all come out amazing. Assembling was easy. The door was a little bent/crooked so at first it wouldn't close all the way but it wasn't too difficult to bend it back to place. I would recommend putting something under it if you are using it on a deck or something that you don't want ruined. There is a black grease that drips from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna A

customer_reviews.title: Great starter
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, quality material. This is my starter smoker, I purchased it thinking that if it was junk I’d be out less than $200. So far I am very pleased with performance, I have smoked chickens and Boston Butts. My only knock is that the thermometer is 10-20 degrees off actual cabinet temp, other than that, easy cleanup, decent temp control and lots of good smoke. Digging the optional beer holder
customer_reviews.author: glenn rhoades

customer_reviews.title: Superb smoker, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to smoke a 10 lb brisket and it did an amazing job. I set it right at 200F and used mesquite chunks from my own property. I smoked it for 12 hours and the brisket was moist and fork tender. I will admit I was dubious at first but this unit came through with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Elizabeth III

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and amazing flavor.
customer_reviews.text: 1st time owning a smoker and it was the best meal I've cooked in awhile. I have no knowledge of using this product, but the instructions were easy and it worked perfectly. Made some ribs and the temp did change but turned out amazing in about 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Liz G.

customer_reviews.title: water pan too small
customer_reviews.text: You will have to baby sit this device to use it. It requires constant (every 15-20 minutes) refilling of water pan. I used it once and have not since it would be such a hassle
customer_reviews.author: John A. Vidal

customer_reviews.title: Overall easy set up, Great Smoker for the value
customer_reviews.text: Was going to get a smokevault but caught this on a deal, very happy with the dual door design. Big fan of this propane smoker- don’t usually leave reviews but this one deserved it. Did leak a little around the door so I’d say invest in a gasket for 10$ and a dual prob thermometer Lowest temp I could keep it at on a warm day was ~200 per the unit. My dual prober thermometer has not yet arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quilty of metals.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed was the quality of the unit. It was excellent, past my expectations. The Build: it took a hour and a half to build. Now for the seasoning and burn off. It fired on the second try. I added wood chips and water ( thanks for the secondary water tray) and the unit was just kicking out the smoke. Thanks . Got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Peace

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SMOKER FOR THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, and not too bad assembly. Make sure you properly "season" your smoker before smoking meats, etc. I use mine to cure my chili pepper for Winter & for lots of chicken, beef, pork & sausages. Works really well, if you have some basic smoking knowledge. Pretty trouble free, just make sure to watch temp. and add some wood chips. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the first smoker I have owned. I have smoked two large batches of Salmon and it (the salmon) is outstanding! It takes a while to get it smoking using damp Alder chips and at the low setting it stays at about 200 degrees. Jury is still out from brisket and other meats. But a great price, simple assembly and light weight for moving and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Karl R.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: The smoker was packed well, no damage. The instructions were easy to follow. some of the best I've seen in a long time, nice diagrams well marked. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: GYJM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. This is our first smoker. Very easy to assemble. Good quality for the price. It did take a while for it to reach the optimal temperature on a 34 degree day. Since we are new to smoking we were not confident of how much we needed to leave the vent open, and if this played a role in it taking so long. We smoked ribs, and pork loins. They turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila G.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Came missing parts, and you cannot order the parts that are missing. You need to take it apart, return it, order another one, and hope that one has all the parts.
customer_reviews.author: Basya Katz

customer_reviews.title: Cook area is 36". Height is 48"
customer_reviews.text: Just opened and put together for Christmas. It's huge. 36" is the cook area, not the height. It's actually about 48" tall. Hubs says we'll have to cook for an Army.
customer_reviews.author: Tracyp

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for Christmas and he loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: It is here
customer_reviews.text: So far so good came a day late 24 hours late. But it is here. Had to put it together that took about 1 hour or so just me. We will see about the job it does after the 28th.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T.

customer_reviews.title: For a 1st time use, this worked great
customer_reviews.text: I think there is a "learning" curve on how to smoke meat but for the first two attempts, it was great. The temp was something we have to work on but have tips from seasoned smoker friends. Really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bamesberger

customer_reviews.title: Get your own seals
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad smoker, but not very straight. It does not seal completely nor does it have any seals I had to order seals to install in order to get it to seal and smoke still comes out of the door. For the price it’s ok but not over a 3 star
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I got this smoker for my husband for Father’s Day. He was so surprised! He has used it several times and made delicious food every time. I would definitely purchase it again. Good value for the price also.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: This got a "why did you buy that" from the wife. Probably used it a dozen times this summer. Quite pleased with the results. Son who is a cook has become the prime user when he gets stuck having to cook at home. Surprised how long the propane tank has lasted given the use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Ostwald

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price - minor small issues
customer_reviews.text: Perfect smoker, easy (but slightly time consuming) to assemble! Frame was warped slightly which made the main door rub on the bottom door. Not too much of an issue but over time will cause rusting. Only able to go up to 220F on Max output, wish I could go a little higher...
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good performance!
customer_reviews.text: Great compact smoker. Easy to use and plenty of space for multiple racks of ribs/brisket/chicken. The only complaint is that the water reservoir does take a lot of tending to as it quickly runs dry. Other than that, you'll be pleased with the performance and the value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First big smoker
customer_reviews.text: Great size have used once so far with ribs and a pork roast, all came out great. Takes some time to get use to how to adjust the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed as doesn’t get hot enough
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed as we cannot get the temperature to go above slightly over 200 degrees. We’ve built an enclosure to protect from the wind, it’s over 80 degrees outside and nothing helps.
customer_reviews.author: Che m

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Only minor issue is that the second shelf from bottom interferes with locking mechanism of main door. Not a big deal though. I drilled a few extra holes at top to move shelves to top for drying jerky. Have done 3 chickens, turkey, tri tip, and pork ribs. Best ever according to wifey!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would buy another one if and when mine wears out !
customer_reviews.text: It a Great smoker But buy a door gasket to seal it better
customer_reviews.author: Billy D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Packages arrived fast, started to put it together and noticed that there was only 2 hole drilled untested of 3 like the other 2, was missing at least 2 racks, Called Amazon, they shipped another and it arrived in 3 days, new one was perfect
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Once looking
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, it looks very nice. We have used it a few times and the flavor is good
customer_reviews.author: serina

customer_reviews.title: Much bigger than expected!
customer_reviews.text: It was relatively easy to put together--the instructions were very thorough. I have only used it once so far, but the results were amazing! I placed an oven a thermometer inside as I had heard that smoker temperature gauges are usually not accurate. The temperature gauge on this one was spot on! Easy to operate. I am excited to try new recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Payton

customer_reviews.title: Smoking good deal
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker, no trouble keeping it lit, maintains temperature. I use it every chance I get. Ribs, chicken, I smoked a try tip in it last week it was a big hit. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been All My Life
customer_reviews.text: Love this smoker. I don’t have a single negative thing to say about it after a month of use. It holds temp well. It’s easy to clean. It’s just exceptional quality for the price. It seals perfectly. If you get one that doesn’t, return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is a decent smoker for the price. We had to modify this due to the number of leaks throughout the unit. The starter doesn't work, so we have to light the gas by hand and the bottom of the upper door is bent and cracked, so lots of air gets in. If the wind is blowing at all, you'll have to block around the bottom to keep the flame from going out AND to keep the temperature up. If you'd be willing to replace the starter and the upper door with working parts, I'd reevaluate my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Davis

customer_reviews.title: SHMOKED MEATSH
customer_reviews.text: Tasty smoked meats. Drip pan got tiny holes in it after a few uses. Easy to clean. Easy to maintain temperature. About 5 uses on one tank of propane.
customer_reviews.author: NerfDruidHealers

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has a lot of room for meats to smoke. I like that it's portable. It runs out of water pretty quickly and the top piece isn't right enough to keep as much smoke in as is like. That being said, overall a good product that I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: colleenb12

product_meta.title: Cuisinart COS-244 Vertical 36" Propane Smoker, Black
product_meta.description: The Cuisinart Vertical 36" propane smoker provides ample smoking space with its 4 stainless steel racks & 784 square" of cooking surface. Turning the valve on a propane tank & twisting the control knob is all it takes to start this smoker. The tightly sealed doors will help with consistency while adjusting the back vent will raise or lower the smoker's temperature. This smoker doesn't have to just be used for large cuts of meat & long smoking sessions. With the ease of use & multiple cooking racks, you'll be able to smoke fun new appetizers for a party or even a more traditional meal during the week. The Cuisinart Vertical 36" propane smoker will add wonderful smoky flavor to anything you put inside. Smoke some chicken breasts for dinner in under two hours, some stuffed mushrooms for one hour, or a thick cut of meat for 10+ hours. The possibilities are endless with this propane smoker & smoking food has never been easier!
feature_bullets: 5. 45 SQUARE FEET OF INTERIOR: The spacious 5. 45 square foot interior means there is plenty of room to smoke a variety of meats along with several trays of vegetables. The vertical footprint makes it a perfect size for patios and barbecue kitchens.
Product Dimensions: 19.3" L x 18.1" W x 38.6" H | Weight: 69.5 lb
FOUR 14 X 14-INCH REMOVABLE STAINLESS STEEL SHELVES: Four stainless steel racks can be easily removed for smoking whole birds or large cuts of meat. Racks are dishwasher safe, making cleanup easy.
BUILT-IN THERMOMETER: Features easy-to-read thermometer on the front door for accessible monitoring of the internal temperature.

TOTAL TEMPERATURE AND SMOKE CONTROL: An adjustable gas supply gives control over the amount of heat. Optimal smoker access through two doors and a rear vent can be opened or closed to control the amount of heat and smoke exiting the oven.
SEAL-TIGHT TWIST-LOCK DOOR AND HANDLE: The door stays tightly sealed with a twist of the handle.
PORCELAIN ENAMELED STEEL TRAY HOLDS WOOD AND WATER: A porcelain enamel steel tray holds the wood chips and water so clean-up is easy after use. Smoker requires wood chips when grilling.
40-INCH PROPANE HOSE AND REGULATOR: Includes a 40-inch hose and regulator that attaches quickly to a standard propane tank. Grill works with 20lb propane tank. (propane not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars600 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
